document.docAuthor: Yu, Hao, Sun, Zixuan & Zhang, Guren
document.masterDocTitle: New taxonomic data on the sac spiders (Arachnida: Araneae: Clubionidae) from China, with description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New taxonomic data on the sac spiders (Arachnida: Araneae: Clubionidae) from China, with description of a new species

bibRefCitation.author: Hu
bibRefCitation.refString: Hu, J. L. (2001) Spiders in Qinghai-Tibet Plateau of China. Henan Science and Technology Publishing House, 658 pp.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Clubiona linzhiensis
Hu, 2001
: 286
, f. 165.1 – 3 (female holotype and
5 female
paratypes from China , Tibet, Mt. Sejila)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Additional material.
15 females
, CHINA : Tibet, Mt. Sejila, Linzhi County ( 29 ° 36 ʹ 3.36 "N, 94 ° 36 ʹ 26.22 "E, 4198m ),
1 June 2011
, Hao Yu and Ci Ren Da Jie leg;
40 females
and
5 males
, collection site as above ( 29 ° 36 ʹ 19.44 "N, 94 ° 36 ʹ 16.8 "E, 4211m ),
31 July 2011
, Hao Yu and Ci Ren Da Jie leg;
27 females
and
12 males
, collection site as above ( 29 ° 36 ʹ 18.84 "N, 94 ° 36 ʹ 20.58 "E, 4201m ),
2 August 2011
, Hao Yu and Ci Ren Da Jie leg.

Diagnosis . This species is similar to
Clubiona cordata
Zhang & Zhu, 2009
in having the similar RTA and VTA, the slender embolus, the bulge and enlarged bulb in male, and in having a cordiform epigynal atrium in female but can be distinguished by: ( 1 ) presence of a small and suboval tegular apophysis (
Figs 19 –21
,
32– 34
), but absent in
C. cordata
; ( 2 ) conductor with a sharp tip (
Figs 19 –21
,
32– 34
), but with a blunt tip in
C. cordata
; ( 3 ) spermathecae smaller, long and tubular (
Figs 28 –29
,
38– 39
), instead of bigger and fan-shaped in
C. cordata
.
Description. Male: Total length 5.53 . Prosoma 2.44 long, 1.85 wide; opisthosoma 2.90 long, 1.72 wide.

Eyes. AER slightly recurved, PER procurved. AME dark, other eyes light; with black rings. Eye sizes and interdistances: AME 0.10 , ALE 0.13 , PME 0.12 , PLE 0.13 . AME–AME 0.10 , AME–ALE 0.06 , PME–PME 0.25 , PME–PLE 0.17 , MOQL 0.36 , MOQA 0.33 , MOQP 0.48 .

Legs . Yellowish, without distinct color markings. Leg formula: IV, II, I, III; leg measurements: I 6.54 ( 1.78 , 2.60 , 1.35 , 0.81 ), II 7.35 ( 2.11 , 2.76 , 1.66 , 0.82 ), III 5.62 ( 1.67 , 1.93 , 1.45 , 0.57 ), IV 7.45 ( 2.14 , 2.46 , 2.17 , 0.68 ).

Palp (
Figs 18 –26
,
32– 37
): Tibia of palp short, with two apophyses, VTA short and with a blunt tip, partly membranous; RTA dark, sharp and strong, triangular; cymbium longer than wide, oval bulb bulge and prolapse; sperm duct sinuated; embolic base represented by enlarged tubercle, gradually tapering toward its apex; conductor membranous; tegular apophysis semi-translucent, small and oval.
Eyes. Eyes with black rings. Eye sizes and interdistances: AME 0.11 , ALE 0.14 , PME 0.11 , PLE 0.12 . AME– AME 0.12 , AME–ALE 0.09 , PME–PME 0.25 , PME–PLE 0.14 , MOQL 0.38 , MOQP 0.51 , MOQA 0.33 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 17–21 .
Clubiona linzhiensis Hu, 2001
, male. 17 male habitus, dorsal view; 18 left male palp, ventral view; 19 embolus area, prolateral view; 20 ditto, ventral view; 21 ditto, retrolateral view. Scales bars=1mm (17); 0.5mm (18); 0.1mm (19–21).

FIGURES 22–26 .
Clubiona linzhiensis Hu, 2001
, male. 22 left male palp, prolateral view; 23 ditto, retrolateral view; 24 left palpal tibia, dorsal view; 25 ditto, ventral view; 26 ditto retrolateral view. Scales bars=0.5mm (22, 23); 0.1mm (24–26).

FIGURES 27–31 .
Clubiona linzhiensis Hu, 2001
, female (27–29) and living specimens with their sacs (30,31). 27 female habitus, dorsal view; 28 epigyne, ventral view; 29 vulva, dorsal view; 30 Sacs in bark; 31 Spider with its sac. Scales bars=1mm (27); 0.2mm (28–29).

FIGURES 32–39 .
Clubiona linzhiensis Hu, 2001
, male and female. 32 embolus area, prolateral view; 33 ditto, ventral view; 34 ditto, retrolateral view; 35 left palpal tibia, dorsal view; 36 ditto, ventral view; 37 ditto retrolateral view; 38 epigyne, ventral view; 39 vulva, dorsal view. Scales bars=0.1mm (32–37); 0.2mm (38–39).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Natural History.
C. linzhiensis
inhabits pine forest ranging between 2,900–4,200 m in elevation on Mt. Sejila. This is in accordance with data of the type locality provided by
Hu ( 2001 )
. The spiders weave sacs in bark, and they usually hide in these sacs. It is a typical habit of sac spiders (
Figs 30–31
).

Remark.
C. linzhiensis
was described by
Hu ( 2001 )
based on six female specimens from Linzhi County, Tibet. Additional
17 males
and
81 females
were collected in this field investigation, among which five pairs of male and female were captured in mating.
